results.summary: A memorial service for two Big Issue sellers who were stabbed to death in Birmingham has been held at a city centre church.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/5380e31c-deb4-004d-abc2-17327a129c43"><paragraph role="introduction">A memorial service has been held in Birmingham for two Big Issue sellers who were stabbed to death in the city.</paragraph><paragraph>Ian Gladwish, 31, and Wayne Busst, 32, were killed in Union Street almost two weeks ago. A 23-year old man has been charged with their murders. </paragraph><paragraph>The service was held at St Martin's Church in the city centre.</paragraph><paragraph>Big Issue founder John Bird described the two men as being "very, very popular".</paragraph></body>

65498999.caption: Ian Gladwish, 31, and Wayne Busst, 32, were killed in Union Street almost two weeks ago

results.headline: Stabbed Big Issue sellers: Birmingham memorial service
results.shortHeadline: Service for killed Big Issue pair
